column1: length ball swinging across the stumps, finishing around an off-stump line. Stays in the crease to defend into the covers
this one starts on around middle stump and swerves away into the fifth-stump channel. Left alone
a bit more width, opens his bat face and jabs to the left of third man

lovely shot. A touch fuller, angling across to a fourth-stump line without too much swing away, and Kusal takes a step forward and shows it the full face of the bat to punch into the big gap to the left of cover

change of angle plus change in direction of swing. Into the left-hander now, and he comes forward to defend and is beaten by the swing and extra bounce. No lbw appeal, though, that was definitely going over the stumps
length ball close to off stump, defended into the point region
back of a length, angling across into the fourth-stump channel, punched into the point region
back of a length, straightens slightly towards off stump, hops to ride the bounce and plays it down towards square leg
length ball angling across the stumps. Stays on the back foot once more, uses his wrists to play it down to the left of the bowler
full on leg stump, clipped to square leg
length ball on off stump, clipped towards mid-on and square leg runs quickly to his right to intercept
slants this a bit wider outside off, but it isn't short enough to cut. Zips past Karunaratne's outside edge as he tries that shot, and Bumrah starts with a maiden
length ball straightening along an off-stumpish line, defended to short extra

back of a length, angling into leg stump. The ball stops on him as he tries the short-arm jab, and the ball hits the toe end of the bat and squeezes away past midwicket diving to his left. He was aiming to hit through backward square leg
Two slips means a big gap between backward point and extra-cover, and Karunaratne slaps this ball into that very gap. Bad ball, short and wide with no swing
not the greatest of starts from Bhuvneshwar, strays onto the legs this time, and Dimuth works it off his hip through the vacant square leg region
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
length ball on off stump, punched to the left of mid-on
length ball angling across into the fourth-stump channel, presses forward and pushes towards backward point
back of a length, putching outside leg and heading towards middle stump or so, hit on the pad as he looks to flick against the angle
back of a length close to off stump, gets up on his toes and punches firmly but Jadeja dives right at backward point and denies him runs

gone, is it? Dhoni's convinced, and Karunaratne begins walking. Width on this occasion, but it isn't short enough to cut, and he plays it with an angled bat rather than a horizontal bat, and only manages a top edge
length ball straightening towards top of off. Doesn't come forward, gets squared up and squirts his defensive shot towards backward point
again he gets it to straighten against the angle. A little fuller, and Avishka is half-forward to play this. Squared up again, and the ball goes into the covers

oh my, miscommunication! That wasn't full enough for the big hit down the ground, and he ends up too far underneath the ball rather than behind it. Scoops it high in the air, somewhere between mid-on and mid-off, more towards the latter. Kuldeep, going to his right, drops the catch, and nearly collides with Pandya coming in the other direction
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
looks for the inswinger to the left-hander, ends up swerving it down the leg side, past the attempted flick

fullish inswinger, attacking middle stump, and Kusal is slow getting forward to it. Ends up not being close enough to the pitch of the ball, and pops the ball in the air, but to the right of Kohli at short midwicket
length ball, too much width, and he just stands there and crashes it between backward point and cover point
length ball angling into off stump, clipped towards midwicket

length ball, strays too straight, and Kusal nudges it off his legs nice and fine, to the left of Bumrah at fine leg, and it races away quickly, too quick for Bumrah to attempt the dive despite getting fairly close to the ball
short outside off, and Avishka stands tall and slaps it firmly, but Jadeja once again cuts it off with a dive to his left at backward point
length ball on off stump, punched to mid-off
length ball straightens towards off stump. Not fully behind it in defence, but plays it well enough to extra-cover

big appeal, given! That big Bumrah angle, and Avishka has tried to drive down the ground without getting a stride forward. He's reviewed it, and the thing to look out for, I think, is whether it might have missed off stump. The ball went past the inside edge and hit the back thigh pad, so height may also be an issue. It's going over the top of leg stump, ball-tracking says. No footwork from Avishka, just looked to stand there and punch through the line, down the ground
full on off stump, driven firmly down the ground, and it runs away for four despite Bumrah getting the fingertips of his right hand to it in his follow-through. First runs off Bumrah
bouncer close to off stump. Thinks of pulling but realises it's too high for that, and leaves it alone in the end

length ball straightening towards off stump, defended towards short extra-cover. Once again he didn't really get behind the line in defence - his back foot stayed on leg stump, which will interest India's bowlers
fullish, close to off stump, lot of bottom hand in this whippy drive, not quite middled, to mid-on

a bit of swing into Kusal, but into his pads, tickled to the right of Bumrah at short fine leg. He moves quickly and fires a throw at the keeper's end, but misses. Avishka would have been home even if it had hit
fullish, close to off stump, defended to the right of extra-cover
outswinger, perhaps a touch too full and definitely too wide of off stump. Not too much footwork from Avishka, but he holds his shape nicely and frees his arms to drive between point and cover
fullish length ball on middle stump, defended to mid-on

full outside off, and Avishka goes for the big hit over mid-on. A good idea with the field restrictions, but he doesn't really middle it. Hangs in the air for quite a while, and it comfortably clears the fielder running back, but it plops down in the outfield and just stops there

is that an edge? There was a sound, and both Sri Lankan openers have walked. Bumrah's been getting the ball to straighten against his angle all through this spell, and it happens again. Slants across the left-hander, straightens back just a touch, and Kusal, looking to punch to mid-on, gets an inside edge on it that Dhoni does well to catch, falling low to his right. On TV, Kumar Sangakkara notes that Kusal's bat was coming down from gully, and slicing across the line as a result
length ball angling into top of off, gets back and across and defends down the pitch
back of a length, angling into middle stump, steps across to work it to fine leg
what a shot. Footwork? What's that? Why do I need it? Why, indeed, Avishka. A touch short, a touch wide, and he just stands there and frees his arms and drives it away through point
shot! That's exceptional from Avishka. Banged into the pitch, gets up above the left shoulder, and he swivels on his back leg in a flash to pull to the backward square leg boundary
length ball on off stump, defended back to the bowler
fullish outswinger, starts fairly wide of off stump, left alone

ooh, that's a beaut. Excellent length, though the line is still a little wide of off stump. Kusal took a step out of his crease initially, and across his stumps to get close to the ball, and late swing beats his edge as he looks to play the forward defensive
length ball, sixth-stump line, left alone

ooh, opened up completely. Length ball starting to swing and straighten along a middle-stump line - was it late swing or seam? - and Kusal makes the mistake of looking to close his bat face and work it leg side. Leading edge rolls into the covers
fullish outside off, driven to the left of mid-off, where Kuldeep misfields and makes it easier for the batsmen to run a single
full on middle stump, clipped to short midwicket. The fielder was in a catching position and the ball was in the air briefly, but it fell well short
full outside off, nice stride forward to defend
back of a length outside off, gets across his stumps to get closer to the line, and just drops his bat down on the top of the bounce to guide it down to third man
back of a length, fifth-stump line, punched (though it was a more flowy than punchy bat-swing) to cover point
length ball, closer to off stump, lets it come on and steers down to third man
bouncer rising over off stump, keeps his eye on it and ducks under it
back of a length outside off, frees his arms and jabs towards cover point
flat length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
tossed up slower and wider, driven to deep point
full and flat on off stump, defended back to the bowler

Gone! Impatience gets the better of Mendis, and Jadeja finds turn in his first over. A little slower than usual, and he jumps out of his crease, but he gets nowhere near the pitch of the ball. Flails desperately at it, looking to hit over mid-off, maybe, and the ball spins past his outside edge. Dhoni does the rest
flat length ball on middle and leg, gets a nice stride forward to defend
flat, a touch shorter, angling into the pads, nudged away through backward square leg
length ball on off stump, defended back to the bowler
length ball outside off, nice stride forward to defend into the covers
length ball angling into off stump, Mathews does the Mathews shuffle across to off stump, and tucks it neatly to the right of midwicket

gone, and Hardik Pandya's slower-ball bouncer continues to take wickets. It's angling into the batsman, cramping him for room, and gets up to shoulder height. Looks to lean away and ramp it towards third man, but it keeps following him, and when the edge is taken, it's very close to the shoulder of the bat. The ball dies on its way through to Dhoni, who takes another very good catch, tumbling to his left and taking it inches off the ground
length ball angling into off stump, and he stays on the back foot to defend into the covers
good bouncer, angling in and rising over off stump. Thirimanne leans his upper body away from the line to let it go
back of a length on off stump, stays leg-side of the ball and punches to deep point
on the pads, clipped through square leg
flat length ball on off stump, punched into the covers
slower length ball on off stump, prods forward to push into the point region

tossed up slow again, fuller this time, stretches out for a soft-hands push into the covers. They chance the quick single, and Thirimanne is forced into a dive to make his ground at the keeper's end. Kohli had to sprint in a fair distance from cover, and move to his left to get the ball into his throwing hand
flat length ball angling across the left-hander. Presses forward but doesn't get close to the pitch of the ball, and the ball spins back in and hits the inside edge of his defensive bat
back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers
bouncer rising steeply over off stump, gets down low, down on one knee, to get under it
slower short ball angling into leg stump. Steps across and swipes it to fine leg
another slower short ball. Angling across to the left-hander's off stump. Gets across to tuck it off his hip, into the backward square leg region
length ball close to off stump, defended towards backward point
slower short ball outside off, waits a decade before playing a checked pull to deep square leg
flat length ball on off stump, makes a bit of room and punches to cover. There's a short, straight extra-cover too. And a slip
looks to cut but the ball skids through and hits the bottom edge and rolls towards backward point
tossed up slow on middle and off, defended back to the bowler
fuller outside off, gets forward for the push to deep point
a step down the pitch to this one floated across to off stump, clipped to midwicket
flat length ball on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
loopy length, over the wicket, right up to the bat and blocked
on the back foot, wafted down to long-on from outside off stump
firmly forward, head over the ball, blocked
sliding down the leg side
tentatively forward, poking back down the pitch with a vertical bat
solid in defence, half-forward on off stump. Very tight lines
big spinner, turning away from the left-hander, and tapped airily out to point for the single
punched off the back foot, to mid-on
Jadeja's usual darting line into the pads, tapped calmly to wide mid-on for the single
thumps the gloves this time, probing away on a stump-threatening line, and taking a dangerous inside edge into the crease
poking forward, striving to get outside the line to those devious darts
nudged into the off side with an open face
flicked off the pads to midwicket. More boa-like constriction
tossed up, into the toes, half-stopped at mid-on by Pant and so nearly a run-out! Mathews wanted nothing to do with it as Thirimanne charged down the pitch. Close!
tucked square for the single
clipped down the pitch, another single
more air this time, sliding into the arc for a slog-sweep off the pads. Square leg swings round to gather
flicked out to the leg side
round the wicket, dobbed onto a good length, can't do much with that
fenced from deep in the crease, into the covers, thinks of the single but thinks better of it
poky defence, back down the track. Nothing to work with here
solidly blocked into the off-side as Jadeja rattles through one of his supersonic overs. Four balls gone in a blink
opens the face on this one and that's well paced towards third man. A long chase and back they come for the third
over the wicket to the left-hander, who closes the face on a drive and can't work it away through the leg-side field
firmly forward to block
lots of air, dipping late, tapped to the leg side with a walking stride to the pitch
punched with a full face to mid-on
slow and loopy, dipping outside off, tapped to point for another single. Sri Lanka intent on building a partnership at all costs
slow turn on a wider line, and that has sat up to be spanked through point! Good patience, and rewarded at last
tighter line to finish the over
round the wicket, on the spot. Blocked
a rare suspicion of width, pushed firmly into the covers
dipping from round the wicket into the pads, clipped to the leg side and finds the gap this time
slower through the air, outside off, tapped behind point
worked to the off side, Kohli is on hand to cut off the single
another blink-and-you-miss-it over fizzes by! Matthews prods the gap to keep the strike
firmly forward in defence
solid lines, no way through once more
a bottom-handed punt into the leg side
sliding into the pads from back of a length, Matthews shuffles back to work to the leg side
down on one knee, thumped over deep midwicket! Picked the length early and swung through the line. Top boshing
head over the ball, firmly forward to defend
worked into the leg side, clipping off the pads
firmly punched with lots of bottom hand, from deep in the crease to mid-on
dabbed to point from round the wicket
tapped to the leg side, sharp single off the pads
poked to point, nothing to work with whatsoever
firmly forward, trying the batsman's patience as he nudges out of his crease to defend
tapped to mid-on, Sri Lanka continue to sit deep and rebuild
turning into the left-hander, who defends off the back foot into the covers
a hint of footwork this time, making room to the leg-side to drive down to long-on
dipping into the toes, fenced into the covers off a hint of leading edge
a fraction shorter, drilled with intent into the covers off the back foot, half-stopped
opens the face to glide a cut/drive into the covers. Up comes the hundred as the rebuild continues...
defended back down the pitch
cracked into the covers, firmly struck but well stopped
pushed into the off side once more
finds the gap in the covers this time with a firm drive
flicked off the toes into the gap at midwicket
round the wicket, punched back to the bowler
looping onto an off-stump line, pressed firmly to mid-on
advances to the pitch, flicks a single to deep midwicket
beats the outside edge with a big turner
tapped off the pads, out to square leg
blocked with a high elbow into the leg side
superb placement! Just a gentle push into the covers, and somehow finds a completely unguarded gap, trickling over the rope at deep extra. Valuable runs
round the wicket, banged in short, a bit of a loosener, well outside off stump
worked off the hips out to deep square leg
short again, the third in a row, and this one is pulled firmly out to deep midwicket
flashed down to third man with an open face, slightly wider and fuller line
firm in defence once more, pushed down to long-on
cracked firmly into the covers, challenging for the sweeper who does well to gather one-handed on the run and limit the damage
on the back foot, deflected behind point for another single
back of a length, outside off, tapped to cover. A slip is in place as India probe for a wicket
outside off, slung across the left-hander, thumped to cover
back of a length, tight line shaping in towards the off stump, blocked on the back foot to mid-on
nurdled around the front pad, gathered at midwicket
defended on the back foot
a swish, and just missed! Back of a length, seduced by the wider line, climbed into the cut but didn't get anything on it.
whistles through the pull and clips the thigh pad
on the back foot, nudged to the leg side
banged in short, through to the keeper
on the back foot, flicked to the leg side
finds the gap once more with a deflection off the legs. Sri Lanka keep playing it cool
a toe-ended swat into the covers. Ungainly but effective, and keeps the strike
flipped to the leg side, meeting the tight line with a measured clip
plinked off the toes, out to the deep midwicket sweeper, who has to make a lot of ground as they jog back for two
poked into the covers, good discipline in this over, using Bumrah's pace to work the gaps
round the wicket, speared into the toes, firmly punched down into the pitch and up into Bumrah's grasp for a crowd catch
angled into the legs this time, worked off the pads and back they come again
round the wicket, banged in short, Thirimanne leans back to pull but can't time it
back foot, and butchered through midwicket! Too short from Pandya, not quick enough, and pounded to the rope
on the back foot, blocked to the leg side
nurdled to the leg side
short, pulled, not timed at all! Bobbles off a top-edge, but safely to space at square leg. Three men back for that very stroke though ...
short again, but Mathews has more time to roll his wrists on the pull and deflect it behind square
loopy bouncer, slower ball. Does the job as Dhoni gathers on about the eighth bounce
swinging away, outside off, eased into the covers with an open-faced drive
supreme strike! Thirimanne recognises this is the bowler to target ... uses his feet with effortless poise to batter a drive through the covers
firmly struck through the off side again, but on a slightly tighter line and length. Can't pierce the gap this time
over the wicket, tight line and thumps the pad, though it pitched outside leg
opens the face for a glide to third man but backward point gathers. That was a slower-ball cutter
full and swinging away, steered down to third man for the single
on the legs, can't nurdle it square
short again, sharper pace, swings into a pull but wears it in the chest as it deflects to third man
back of a length again, hauled out to deep midwicket
climbing into the short ball again but can't line it up
so nearly the breakthrough! A slower off-spinning short ball, Thirimanne is in no position whatsoever to play it yet somehow chips a leading edge over Dhoni's head and down to third man!
picks off the single to bring up a battling half-century. Well played Angelo Mathews ... he's giving his side a chance
tossed up slow, floating across towards off stump, defended into the covers
slow flight again, full on off stump, driven to long-off
stock ball, slightly slow, turns away from off stump, chopped to backward point, where Bumrah misfields to allow the single
again it's super slow, and this time outside off. Mathews' bottom hand comes into the drive and he nearly pops a return catch to Kuldeep
wrong'un on leg stump, super slow once more. Turns his bat face early and the leading edge rolls into the point region
down the track to the flighted one on leg stump, whips it to the right of deep square leg
length ball on off stump, defended to midwicket
fullish on off stump, and mid-off is in the circle and Mathews simply lofts it over that fielder. Gets his front leg out of the way and brings his bat down nice and straight
back of a length close to off stump, opens his bat face and guides it down to third man
bouncer outside off, angling across, and Thirimanne ignores it
not the greatest day for Bhuvneshwar. Short ball, angling across to off stump, sits up at waist height and Thirimanne brings up the century partnership with a pull to the left of deep square leg
short one, gets up over the back shoulder, controls the hook nicely and keeps it down to deep square leg

tossed up on leg stump, and that's deft work from Thirimanne, gets on the front foot, gets his head over the ball, and uses his wrists to work it against the turn, and really fine, to the right of the keeper
full again, but flatter and on middle stump, driven back to the bowler
a touch short, close to off stump, waits on it and slaps to deep point
tossed up on off stump, and brings out the reverse-sweep. Knows backward point and third man are in the circle, and deliberately hits it in the air, up and over backward point
flat, spins down leg, past the attempted flick. Leg-bye is the signal, so maybe a tickle off the pad
down the track but can't get to the pitch of this slow, flighted one outside off. Slow enough for him to thrust his pad out towards the line and defend into the covers

dropped. This has been a horrible day for Bhuvneshwar Kumar. Chances his arm, goes against the turn for the big shot down the ground. Wants to get it further to the long-on fielder's right, but the turn makes him hit straighter than intended. Bhuvneshwar sprints right, slides, gets both hands to it, and drops it
flat length ball, defended into the covers
slower, on off stump, stretches out and blocks it back to the bowler
flatter now, blocked back to the bowler again
bam. A bit of flight, and Mathews clears his front leg a little and absolutely wallops it back over the bowler's head and into the sightscreen
tossed up on off stump, gets forward to defend but it doesn't turn as much as expected, inside-edges into the square leg region
tossed up full on middle stump. Wants to drive to long-on but the turn makes him hit to midwicket instead
flatter, on leg stump, goes back and tucks it to backward square leg
tossed up slow on off stump, stretches out and works it with the turn to long leg

down the track, and Thirimanne goes against the run of play. Kuldeep's slowness and dip does him in. Wants to make room and hit over extra-cover, but the ball dips shorter than he wants, and turns away. Ends up slicing it instead for a simple catch to Jadeja taking a couple of backward steps at backward point
greets him with a wrong'un, and he plays inside the line and sends the ball running away into the third man region
flat length ball on the stumps, blocked back to the bowler
slower and fuller on off stump, driven to long-off

appeal for a stumping - did Mathews lift his foot? This is that most difficult Jadeja ball to face, the flat, quick one that spins sharply. Gets forward to defend but the ball pitches shorter than expected, making him reach for it, and rips past his outside edge. Dhoni, as always, is electric with the glovework. Where was Mathews' foot? Is it on the line, or is some part of it grounded behind it? There appears to be just a bit of bat grounded behind the crease, and the third umpire flashes the not-out sign on the big screen

wow. That wasn't the cleanest of strikes. Flat one angling into the stumps, and he clears his front leg for the swipe over long-on. Hits the outside half of the bat, close to the leading edge, but it still carries all the way
bowls this wider outside off, and he stretches out for a push into the covers
short, just a bit of width, and Mathews springs onto the back foot and slashes it away to the right of short third man. He's really picked up the pace in these last few overs
floated slowly across, and Dhananjaya is too early on his sweep. Hit on the pad, outside the line
dangled up slow once again, wide of off, goes for the big cover drive, more hands than feet, and misses
again the wide line, but he gets a good stride out this time to drive to sweeper cover
full outside off, Mathews is in position almost before the bowler's delivered to paddle it to fine leg
flatter, rips in sharply from outside off. DDS wants to stay leg-side of the ball but the turn cramps him, and he turns his wrists to play it to long-on

another reverse-sweep. Again those two fielders behind square on the off side are in the circle - and they have to be, given the middle-overs field restrictions - and he uses his hands brilliantly to whip it over backward point
shortish, angling into leg stump, tucked off the hip to fine leg
slower ball, back of a length on off stump. Shuffles across and tucks it to deep square leg
full, angling in towards off stump. Gets forward to drive, aiming towards mid-off, perhaps, but the angle makes him play it down the ground instead, past the stumps and to the left of mid-on
bouncer outside off, rises too high to bother Mathews unduly but he ducks anyway
slower offcutter, back of a length and close to off stump. Shapes for the punch through cover, ends up defending back to the bowler instead
in the blockhole, close to off stump, jabbed to the right of Jadeja at backward point
length ball on off stump, DDS - as he usually does - stays on the back foot to work it to square leg
slower ball on middle and leg, nudged away through midwicket
short ball, gets up above the right shoulder, pulls it along the ground to deep square leg with a roll of the wrists
in the blockhole, angling across and pitching just outside off. Brings his bottom hand into play to whip it back to the bowler

sees Mathews shaping to make himself room and fires a full one wide of off stump, out of Mathews' reach. It's another slower one, and it bounces again before reaching Dhoni, and turns like an offbreak to beat him and run away for four byes
short one on the stumps, pulled to deep square leg
steps out, but steps out too early, and Pandya foxes him with a slower one into the pitch, short and just outside off. Tries to chop it away square, but the ball beats him with lack of pace
fullish, angling into off stump. Stays back and looks for a push through the covers, ends up inside-edging through square leg, thanks to the angle
yorker close to off stump. Looks to jab it through point, but the angle again makes him hit leg side, off the inner half of the bat to midwicket
shortish, gets up to about ribcage height above off stump, tucks Dhananjaya up for room. Late on the pull, and he ends up hitting it into the ground by his feet
back of a length close to off stump, slower one, lets it come on and dabs it fine of third man
in the blockhole close to off stump, jams down hurriedly and digs it back to the bowler
stump-high full-toss on off stump, fast and angling in. Punched down the ground to long-on

shot! That's short on off stump, only gets up to chest height, and Mathews knows square leg is in the circle. Goes for placement rather than power on this checked pull, just beats the fielder to his right
slower ball, shortish, tucked into the midwicket region
short, down leg, helped away to the right of fine leg
slower short one, angling away from off stump. Beaten by lack of pace as he tries to chop it away through point. And oh, Pandya seems to have overstepped. It's a MASSIVE no-ball
sticks to the same angle, length, and pace of delivery. Loopy bounce, and Mathews, who tries to make room and carve it away over the point region, can't connect

century! This has been a terrific innings from Mathews, who's shown all his quality today after coming in at a tricky time. Another short one angling away from off stump, and this time he carves it away perfectly, over backward point
back of a length. angling into off stump, tucked away through backward square leg
goes full and wide to start, and Mathews eases it away to deep point
slower ball, shortish, plenty of width, but he has a deep point in place for just that ball, and DDS slaps it away to that fielder
short slower ball on off stump, pulled to the right of deep midwicket
full slower one wide of off stump, drags a bottom-handed drive to extra-cover
full outside off, slower one, flat-bats a drive to long-off
slower legcutter wide of off stump, reaches out with a full extension of his arms and slices it over the point region, out to the sweeper on the boundary
shortish slower one outside off, chopped into the cover point region
offcutter on the pads, clipped to deep backward square leg
full on leg stump, and that's a lovely shot from de Silva. Flicks it up and over, and he finds the gap between deep backward square leg and deep midwicket
slower one, full and wide of off stump. DDS gave away his intention of reverse-sweeping a little too early, and Pandya simply moved his line slightly out of his reach

another slower offcutter, dug into the pitch on a length outside off. Leans back to try and dab it past short third man, but there's too little pace on it, and the bounce is too loopy for him to connect
slower bouncer this time, pulled round towards deep backward square leg
full, almost a yorker, close to off stump, swiped down to long-on

ooh, good idea, and the execution almost comes off. Expects the slower length ball outside off, and he makes a bit of room to try and carve it past backward point. Hits it too close to the fielder, though
fuller now, another slower ball, flat-batted to the man at long-off
ridiculously good yorker Only inches away from ripping the off stump out of the ground. Dhananjaya is just waaaay too late in bringing his bat down. Woof. What a ball.

and he's ready for the yorker now. Opens up his stance. Keeps his bat very very low. Crouches as the yorker comes down and then plants the open face on it to try and sneak a boundary through third man. Bhuvi doesn't let him. But wow, was that ever great cricket!
full toss on off stump, Mathews works it down to long-on
sprints across outside off stump, giving away his intentions way too early. Bhuvi has the time to adjust, bang a ball into the pitch right over off stump and beat Mathews' scoop shot
whacks the slower short ball outside off to the midwicket boundary. Top batting from a top player. Having been out there so long, he's able to pick the pace of the ball and punish it
yorker on off stump, Mathews squeezes it out to the sweeper
shapes to pull the short ball angled into him, but it's a slower one as well, demanding that he hold his shape that extra second longer. Does so just about well enough to get a single to long leg
follows him with a low full toss as he makes room outside leg. Mathews basically lets ball hit bat as he finds a single through cover
pulls the short ball from outside off to deep square leg
slower ball, full and wide of off. Steps a long way across and looks to Azharuddin it through midwicket, but plays too early and misses. Ricochets off the pad towards short third man

gone. Not quite in the blockhole, on off stump, and Mathews actually times that really well, making a bit of room and punch-driving, but it's in the air at catchable height, and straight to extra-cover. A few meters either side of him, and that could have been a boundary. End of a wonderful knock, walks off acknowledging a big ovation. Is this the last we'll see of Mathews with the bat in a World Cup match?
low full-toss, jabbed down to long-off
leg-stump yorker, pulls his feet out of the way and jabs towards mid-on
in the blockhole on off stump, gets his front leg out of the way and steers to deep point
low full-toss on leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket

Not if he keeps bowling like this. Inch-perfect leg-stump yorker, and he gets his feet out of the way to try and squeeze it to point, but can only play it back towards the bowler in his follow-through
sees DDS attempting to make room and looks to follow him, and ends up sliding a full-toss down the leg side. They sneak another run to bring Thisara on strike
looks for the wide yorker, and slants it slightly beyond the tramline. Thisara leave it alone

slower ball, fullish, slanting into a wide-ish line outside off. Looks to hit over long-off, but doesn't time it at all, and Pandya takes a stunner to send him back, running in off the long-off boundary, getting up towards the 30-yard circle, and dives forward to take it with two hands. Shades of Ajay Jadeja catching Allan Border in the 1992 World Cup
slower short ball, angling into the stumps and bouncing loopily over them after passing the batsman at waist height. He was trying to make room and reverse-scoop it past short third man
in the blockhole on middle and leg, makes room and jabs to extra-cover
slower one, back of a length, swatted down to long-on
looks to make himself room and Bhuvneshwar follows him with a yorker at his feet. Brings down a straight bat to chip it over the bowler, and pick up two to the right of long-on
back of a length, slung into the pads, tucked off the hip for an opening single
tapped into the leg side, another single as Malinga slides into the legs once again. Striving for swing but not finding any yet
outside off this time, with a touch of shape away from Rahul as he shoulders arms
tight to off stump, back of a length, skidding into a defensive push to cover
wide line, through to the keeper with that slingy round-arm action ghosting it away from the right-hander
full length, into the toes, watchfully pushed to mid-on
firmly fenced off the back foot, sweetly timed to mid-off, who half-stops with a scrambling dive
two slips in place as Rajitha probes an off-stump line to the solidly poised Rohit
short and wide, a gift! Rohit hardly needs to get his feet moving to lace this one through point, a firm toe-ended cut, clean through the field
on the legs, worked behind square
that is sublime! Standing tall on the back foot, hardly moving his bat on impact, just twitching his muscles into a perfectly timed push through the covers!
worked off the legs, a direct hit would be close... but it isn't
Rahul slaughters another drive! Width on offer, a full face through the line, and out goes the second slip, tail between legs, as India's openers click up a gear!
good riposte, full and straight, into the toes and blocked
too wide once more! Such a full length that all Rahul needed to do was lay bat on ball with an open face. Easier said than done, of course, but that was perfection, through third man
much tighter to off stump, similar full length, prodded to point
nudged to the leg side

dismissively perfect! On the pads, swinging in, Rohit barely breaks out of his stance to flick the most casual of leg glances clean through midwicket! About as much energy expended as flicking on the bathroom light switch
clipped leg-sided once again, but not timed on this occasion. Short midwicket gathers on the second bounce
pressed hard back down the pitch, Rajitha dives across his crease, in the air for a moment, but can't reach it. Once again, a touch early on his stroke
clipped down to fine leg
opens the face on the back foot, deflected down to third man
firmly pushed, with the swing, into the covers
a bit of shape through the air as Sharma leans on another off-sided push
short, straight, swivel-pulled to backward square
targetting the toes with an attempted yorker. Blotted to the leg side
pushed into the covers
too wide on a full length, and potted through third man like a snooker cue! Opens the face, knowing full well there's no-one there to intercept it and away she goes!
back-to-back boundaries! Malinga over-compensates, full once again but on the toes, and clipped sublimely through midwicket
outside off, but not too far outside off this time. A well-directed offcutter to keep the batsman honest
flipped round the corner
angular beauty from Rohit! Opens the face on impact to ease a perfectly poised drive through extra cover! Hands and elbows high through the ball, head still. Gorgeous
short and wide, crashed to point, but straight to the man
tucked up on a tighter line, bends double as the ball nips back
a floaty full length, outside off, luring another measured drive, but straight to mid-off
another sweetly timed clip off the legs! Through the covers, through midwicket... there's no safe place to bowl right at this moment!
slower ball, 105kph on a full length, watched onto the bat and blocked
aiming full once again, but sliding into the legs once again. No timing on this clip, for once, as deep midwicket gathers
defended into the leg side
stretching forward to defend once more
back of a length, tight line, another open-faced steer to short third man
nurdled off the toes
poked out to point
solid in defence, full and straight on an off-stump line
banged in, just back of a length, jagging in off the seam and blocked with a hop on the back foot
tucked off the toes to the leg side, short midwicket gathers
nudged square, back of a length on the hips
slower ball, grips in the pitch as Rohit closes the face on a defensive prod and watches it bobble into the leg side
full and straight, defended
shorter ball, whistles through to the keeper as the one for the over
tucked off the pads, into the leg side
outside off, back of a length, ambitiously swished out to point
short and sizzles through to the keeper, passing at chest height as Rahul lowers his gloves to guide it by
line and length, a decent finish to the over, just one run in two overs now
nurdled round the corner, another single to the cause
banged in short, not timed on the pull, under-edged down into the crease
a crashing flog from back of a length, but straight to point
pulled through the leg side, swinging across the line as Rajitha drops his length a fraction
firmly crunched back to the bowler as Rajitha aims fuller this time
cheeky! An arrow-straight short ball, Rahul flexes his knees, lowers himself like an elevator to the ground floor, and skims the thinnest of ramps over the keeper's head! That's got him moving again!
panned fiercely out through point. Straight to the sweeper
full length, angling in from over the wicket, pushed out to point
battered out through point and parried by the fielder, bounced a foot short as he stuck out his right hand
angling away on a full length, opens the face to steer to point
languidly drilled through the covers! Elbows so sharp they could take out your eye, as Sharma presents a full face on a full length, and cashes in!
back of a length, poked down into the crease. India sitting pretty
back of a length, squeezed into the off side
on the back foot, poked to cover
tucked off a straighter line, into the leg side
bottom-handed, punched uppishly out through point as Perera strays a touch wider
fenced down to third man, riding the lift outside off
delfected off the legs into space behind square, another chance to rush back for the second
full length and defended once again
solid in defence, head in line, right behind the ball

deceived, yet dismissed! A cunning slower ball, Rohit is through his stroke so early, yet takes the bottom hand off the bat, lifts up and under the shot, clears mid-off, and plugs inches inside the rope!
wider line, clobbered to point
back of a length, angled from leg to middle, clipped square for another single
pumped out to point, a violent swing through the line with very static feet
on the back foot, angled into the legs, clipped square
blocked on the front foot
nudged out to midwicket, leaning onto the fuller length
cracked on the up to point, no way through there once more
angled down to third man, using a hint of width to pinch the single
attempted drive, but a thick inside-edge into the pads
driven with an open face, easing the ball into the covers from a tight off-stump line
worked into the gap once more
on the back foot, driven into the off side
outside off, tapped down to third man
nudged off the legs once more
gentle swing across the right-hander, a bit of a squirty drive out to point, but safe enough
another flash of a drive, off the back foot, down to deep point
lovely ball, just holds its line outside off and ghosts past the edge as Rohit plays inside the line
guided with a measured cross-bat to third man, back of a length and wide enough to free the arms
solidly onto the front foot, head over the ball in defence
forward again, blocked back to the bowler
open face once more, nudged to point
tossed up first-ball, and launched over extra cover! Dipping into a golf-swing, high and mighty to bring up another fifty!
firm in defence as de Silva finds a better length
absolutely howitzer-ed over the bowler's head! Tossed up again, Rohit marches to the pitch like a schoolmaster to a playground tiff, and dispatches with a wipe of disdain!
flicked to the leg side to keep the strike rotating
whipped to the leg side, no way through there
pushed back onto the stumps this time, Rohit slides back and across to pinch the single to the leg side
back of a length, angling into middle stump, tucked to midwicket

Rahul tries to do a Rohit, shuffling down the track and looking to go over mid-off, but this cross-seam ball pitches slightly shorter than he'd like, outside off, and straightens past his outside edge
back of a length on off stump, shuffles across to work it to deep square leg
shortish outside off, chopped to third man, meeting the ball on top of its bounce
back of a length on off stump, steps across to try and work it leg side, can't get it past midwicket
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler, with a straight bat but a slightly slicing-across-the-line bat trajectory born of an open front shoulder
flat length ball on middle and leg, clipped away through square leg to bring up the century partnership

lovely delivery, grips the pitch and spins in viciously from outside off with extra bounce. Rahul was shaping to make room and punch/cut to the sweeper, but he was cramped for room and ended up jabbing down on it to defend
a bit more width, a bit less turn, punched away through cover point
tossed up full on off stump, clipped to long-on
flat and full on off stump, defended back to the bowler
full on leg stump, clipped to square leg
shortish, no width to cut, the ball bounces extra and beats Rahul's edge
back of a length in the corridor, this time he stands tall and punches with a straight bat to deep point
length ball on off stump, defended back to the bowler
a touch short, close to off stump, and it only needs to be a touch short for Rohit to play that pull - this one's well in front of square, over the fielder at midwicket
back of a length outside off, punched towards backward point
shortish, fourth-stump line. Lets it come on and dabs gently to third man
lovely delivery, floats it across the stumps and gets it to keep going with the angle. Rohit presses forward to defend, plays for turn, and the ball slides past his outside edge
fuller, on the stumps, driven back to the bowler
looks to step out and make room to go through/over extra-cover, but he doesn't get to the pitch, and it spins back in. Jams his bat down to keep it out
bam. Had come out of his crease the previous ball, and Dhananjaya drops the next one short. Rocks back and swats it away through forward square leg
flat, on the pads, clipped away to fine leg
nice length, pitching just outside off and spinning back in. Gets forward and defends it back to the bowler
length ball, a bit of width, and Rohit just stands there and slaps it away over backward point. Third man runs around to mop up

well bowled. Hits that hard length in the corridor, possibly cross-seam again, and gets it to beat Rohit's edge with a bit of away movement and extra bounce. Rohit looked to be premeditating too, clearing his front leg, possibly looking for the pull over midwicket. Ended up poking at the ball with a vertical bat and missed
back of a length close to off stump, punched to deep point
shortish, close to off stump, gets too close to the line with his back-and-across movement, and chops it to backward point
a touch short outside off, Rahul gets in a better position with his back-and-across step this time, still has room for his arms to play the cut and beat backward point to his left
good-looking drive to the full one outside off, short extra-cover dives right and gets an important hand to it
tossed up fairly wide outside off, driven to sweeper cover
flat, shortish, spins down the leg side, Rohit doesn't even attempt to play it
flat on the pads, tickled to the left of short fine leg

bad ball. Short outside off, sits up nicely, and Rahul makes a bit of room and slaps it between cover point and extra-cover to bring up another half-century. He's batted well through this World Cup. He's just waiting for that big score
wham. A bit of flight, and Rahul is swiftly out of his crease, skips inside the line to make more hitting room, and launches it gracefully over long-off
flat and full on leg stump, gets forward to clip towards square leg

down the track once more, and the extra ball in the over - he bowled a wide earlier, remember? - is put away for four. This one's a little wider, so the inside-out lofted drive goes over extra-cover on this occasion
shortish, angling away from off stump. Stops on the pitch a little and he slaps it to cover point
on the pads, clipped to short fine leg, where Malinga fumbles it through his legs to turn a dot ball into a double
length ball angling across to off stump, clipped to deep square leg

nicely played. Back of a length and close to off stump, gets back and across, waits on it, and plays the old-fashioned late cut to third man. It's not the dab with an open face, it's a cut with the wrists rolled over on top of the bounce
slower length ball close to off stump. No pace on it at all, and Rohit punches to the man at cover
length ball close to off stump, stays back and punches to mid-off
short, angling into the batsman, pulled from shoulder height through backward square leg

short, angling down leg, and that's a poor ball, even with fine leg back. Swivels around and pulls fine, and even a big sprint from the fine leg fielder, Udana, to his right, plus a tumble at the end, can't stop it from going for four
looks for the yorker, ends up sliding it down the leg side. Got some late inswing on it, probably reverse
full-toss on the pads, yorker gone wrong, clipped to deep square leg
short, gets up to chest height over off stump, Rohit plays a checked pull to the left of fine leg
full outside off, Rohit plays a sliced drive to the right of third man
slower yorker on off stump, holds his shape well and clips to midwicket
full on middle and leg, defended to midwicket, played that with the full face showing
full on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
nicely bowled, slower cutter pitching just short of a length, within the line of the stumps. Looks to work it leg side, closes his bat face early, and sends a leading edge rolling towards point
shortish, a tiny bit of width, and that's classy from Rohit. A proper square-cut on top of the bounce, and he beats point diving to his left
length ball on middle stump, defended to midwicket

ooh, lucky. Wide length ball, and Rohit goes for the angled-bat slash away from the body. Was in good enough form to middle it, but this one bounces extra and takes the top edge. The diving Kusal Perera can't get his right glove to it, though
short slower ball, ends up sliding down leg, and Rahul aborts his pull
short ball rising shoulder high outside off, drags a pull out to the man at deep square leg
slower length ball close to off stump. Makes room to flay it through the off side, but doesn't get the pace onto the bat. Chops it hard into the ground and it rolls gently into the point region
bouncer close to off stump. Rahul shapes to pull but the ball rises too steeply for him to attempt the shot. The umpires decide it rose above head height
too full, this slower one on off stump. Or not full enough, depending on what length he was looking to bowl. Takes a step forward and just hoicks it up and over wide mid-on
looks for the yorker, bowls a touch too straight. Flicked off the toes to fine leg
low full-toss, too much width, and there's no one sweeping on the off-side square boundary. Cover point is in the circle, and Rohit eases a drive past that fielder's right hand
slower ball, follows Rohit as he shuffles away from leg stump to make room. Clips it quietly through square leg to move to 95 and keep the strike
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and dabs to backward point
back of a length outside off, waits, waits some more, and late-cuts to third man, meeting the ball well behind his body
length ball on off stump. Presses forward, pushes to mid-off, and the fielder is right on the edge of the 30-yard circle so there's an easy single on offer
full outside off, driven to the sweeper at deep point
in the blockhole, just outside off, jams down on it to squeeze it into the point region
shuffles down the track and Udana slightly shortens the length of his slower ball. Clipped watchfully to midwicket
low full-toss on the pads, clipped to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, gets up on his toes to punch to deep point
length ball close to off stump, defended with soft hands into the point region. More a dab than a defensive block, really. He wanted that single but hit it too close to backward point
back of a length outside off, chopped to backward point
slower ball, lots of width, and again Rohit finds backward point. Cut it firmly but straight to the fielder

shortish on off stump, and there's the pull. Becomes the first man to ever score five hundreds at a single World Cup. All in the first round, that too. Puts it away to the square leg boundary, and it's his third hundred in a row as well. What a tournament he's having
slower ball on middle and leg, worked away through square leg
full close to off stump, driven to long-off
length ball, on top of off stump with extra bounce. Keeps it down towards point with a roll of his wrists
length ball on the pads, clipped to the left of deep square leg
shortish, angling into leg stump, tucked off the hip to the left of Malinga at short fine leg
full-toss, about thigh-high, on off stump, blocked back to the bowler

wow. A moment of disbelieving silence in the crowd. Full, close to off stump, and it's the slower ball - did Rohit not pick it? Did he not watch it out of the bowler's hand, momentarily distracted after getting to his hundred? Who knows. He plays a checked drive and spoons it straight to mid-off
on the pads, tucked to the leg side
working the ball from a middle-and-off line, out to midwicket once more
stretching forward, blocking a length ball back down the track from an off-stump line
pierces the covers with ease! Striding forward, presenting the full face of the bat, and whistles to the boundary!
flicked off the pads behind square
half-forward, looking to place bat on ball once more, and finding the middle with a reassuring thud
tip and run, an easy single to the left of mid-on
solid in defence once more
back of a length nudged off the hip to midwicket
poked solidly into the covers again. No lateral movement so no danger at just placing the bat on an off-stump line
fuller length, squeezed down into the pitch with a head-over-the-ball press
angled defence to third man
very full, worked to the leg side
a touch of width outside off, chopped to deep backward point
leaning forward, and defended back down the pitch
cherry-picks the gap at square leg, another half-cocked bouncer dispatched! Sat up to be swatted
pushed deeper into the crease, tapped to the off side off the back foot, sharp calling from Kohli creates the single
nurdled to deep midwicket
pressing forward on an off-stump line
nudged out to midwicket for the single
eased into the covers once more, singles everywhere now
solidly into line to defend
wider line, crunched out to deep cover, not much timing, but finds acres of space all the same
on the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
walks back onto the stumps, to loft a leg-stump lollipop behind square for a single
cracked hard to deep midwicket, a long chase to intercept inside the rope
on the back foot, head over the ball for a punch through the line to the bowler
back and across to defend again on that leg-stump line
round the wicket, floated across the right-hander's bows. Kohli leans forward to block
dabbed to short cover. The shot, that is, not the gesticulation
leaning forward, pushed into the off side
solid in defence, head over the ball
on the leg stump, clipped invitingly to deep midwicket. It's a stroll now
forward and punched to short cover
another single into the off side
on the back foot, flicked hard to the leg side
clipped down to long-on
whipped to the leg side with vigour, the sweeper at backward square gathers
on the back foot, flicked to the leg side with lots of bottom hand
worked to the leg side again to move to 97...
another forceful flick off the legs, Rahul keeps the strike
leaning onto the front foot, pushed to cover
draws the length back, punched into the off side once more
very tight line, back of a length, deflected down into the crease, and Kohli is very alert to rush the single
pinged into the covers, sharp timing but straight to the man
head over the ball, defending with a full-faced push to cover
driven with purpose and timing, but straight to short cover
back of a length, outside off, chopped to third man and Rahul has his World Cup hundred!. A beautifully paced knock, filling the massive void made by Shikhar Dhawan's injury ...
here comes Kohli! There's a sense now that this might end quite quickly. In the slot, pongo-ed over long-on with a dismissive wipe of the bat
inswinging into the toes, a decent delivery, but well watched onto the middle of a leg-side flick
another sweetly timed on-drive, right up to the toes, there's a man back at long-on to intercept
flipped out to deep midwicket, off the toes
pushed into the covers, no way through there
nudged into the covers, finds the gap this time
open-faced poke, back of a length outside off, down to third man
on the back foot, tight line to the body as Rahul leans back but can't find the angle to pick the single to third man
slower ball, slow outswinger on a back of a length. Watched carefully and defended to cover
outside off, crashed to deep extra cover
solid in defence, into the off side
pounded on the up, over the covers! Sweetly struck, positive intent as the finishing line nears!
clears the front dog and mows a dismissive whack over the leg side! Bounces just inside the rope as the fielder is powerless to intercept!
helicoptered off the toes, sizing up the inswinging yorker and flicking it up and over the leg side. That's the shot of a man seeing it very well indeed
more full-faced elegance from Kohli, just a gentle push to cover
slow bouncer, picked off the hips with a measured paddle to square leg

edged, and Malinga gets the late breakthrough! A short ball, doesn't get up, but follows Rahul as he limboes inside the line, and scuffs the faintest of edges through to the keeper! A brilliant hundred is ended by a champion bowler in the final moments of his World Cup career!
gorgeous! Kohli's cover-drives have all been a rehearsal for that one, utterly nailed through the covers with the most serene of followthroughs
deflected down to third man
swinging into the toes, pushed with the angle to mid-on
bottom-handed belligerence! Full length, and dismissively slapped back past the stumps!
thumped to mid-off

slower ball, swinging into a riotous pull, a polite appeal, and Sri Lanka are reviewing! It's not a terrible shout, actually. Misses the bat, and thumped him right amidships ... is it hitting the stumps? It certainly is! Middle stump on the one hand, leg stump on the other! A late bonus for Sri Lanka
sliding into the legs, worked behind square
full face of the bat as Hardik presses a length delivery back past the bowler to get off the mark
too full, leg-sided, Malinga will have that one again
opens the face to dab the wider line down to third man
fuller length, into the legs, tucked square. Smiles from Hardik and Malinga as they pass each other in the middle
banged in short, pulled to the leg side... one more ball for Lasith ...
attempted the trademark yorker to finish, comes out as a full-toss, and clobbered through midwicket! It wasn't to be for Malinga ... India on the brink now
back of a length, blocked back to the bowler
patted down to third man. Scores are level
loopy slower ball, outswinger almosts deceives the batsman, but instead is deflected to third man to seal a thumping, momentum-seizing win!
